example.name: Requests Library

components.name: HTTP Client API
components.purpose: Simple HTTP client interface providing easy-to-use methods for HTTP requests

example.architecture_md:
# Requests Library Architecture

Requests is an elegant and simple HTTP library for Python, built for human beings.

## Core Components

- **Public API**: Simple functions for HTTP methods (get, post, etc.)
- **Session Management**: Persistent session handling with connection pooling
- **Adapters**: HTTP transport adapters built on urllib3

## Design Philosophy

- Simplicity over complexity
- Elegant API design
- Sensible defaults
- Human-friendly error messages
example.mermaid_modules:
graph TD
    A[requests/api.py] --> B[requests/sessions.py]
    B --> C[requests/adapters.py]
    C --> D[urllib3]
example.mermaid_folders:
graph TD
    ROOT[requests]
    ROOT --> SRC[requests/]
    ROOT --> TESTS[tests/]
    ROOT --> DOCS[docs/]
example.mermaid_modules_simple:
graph TD
    A["🌐 HTTP API"] --> B["🔗 Sessions"]
    B --> C["⚡ urllib3"]
    A --> D["🔒 Security"]
example.mermaid_modules_balanced:
graph TD
    subgraph "Requests Library"
        A[Public API] --> B[Session Manager]
        B --> C[HTTP Adapters]
    end
    
    subgraph "External Dependencies"
        D[urllib3]
        E[certifi]
    end
    
    C --> D
    B --> E
example.mermaid_modules_detailed:
graph TD
    A[requests/api.py] -->|"delegates to"| B[requests/sessions.py]
    B -->|"uses"| C[requests/adapters.py]
    B -->|"manages"| D[requests/cookies.py]
    C -->|"built on"| E[urllib3/poolmanager.py]
    B -->|"validates"| F[certifi/core.py]
    A -->|"handles"| G[requests/exceptions.py]
example.description: Elegant and simple HTTP library for Python, built for human beings
